name: Okta
description:
Test cases related to verifying proper Okta session handling of an expired access token.

*OKTA Test Cases (IDK integration) [iDK introduced with iOS 13.2.0]*
User is not logged back in silently, instead user is logged out and welcome screen to be shown. User should be able to perform CTA to successfully log back in 
[NOTE: iOS If user initially logged in via Magic Link, then the keychain is expectedly NOT shown]


*OKTA Test Cases (prior to IDK integration) [iOS prior to 13.2.0]*
Log user back in silently
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1QFYXts7Q_Vjq7bXWr3LCuHEMEQOelckX--M6Uvg8Leg/edit?usp=sharing

------------------

Validation desired:
*Background To Foreground App
*Navigate back and forth from Home Tab
*Pull to Refresh on Wallet Tab
*Navigate to My History from Profile
*Reset Password
*Offline (No Network)

To test expired access tokens either:
-request that the QA token expiration be lowered to 5 minutes in #mlb-identity-eng 
-Intercept the access token response in Charles and override the expiration value

name: [Android] Regression Suite for Releases
description:
Purpose of this test suite is to ensure that there is HIGH level of confidence that the app will function properly in the HIGHEST priority areas of the app. 

The scope of this test suite is limited to a set of test which someone can complete in a single day.

name: OneSignal SDK - Push Notifications & In App Messages
description:
TESTING NOTES:
* The One Signal dashboard can be found here: https://app.onesignal.com/
* To have a device show up as a user in production One Signal Users Tab, you need to run the prod release build (all other variants of prod, staging and qa show up in One Signal's QA Ballpark App)
* To have a InApp Message with trigger show up, you need to include an IN-APP TRIGGER and SESSION DURATION

name: Location
description:
As a fan I want to be able to see local context if my location is allowed on Ballpark app

AC:
* Pass through lat/long to home service if available (i.e. fan has previously allowed location permission to Ballpark)
* Pass through accuracy level (e.g. precise, approx)
* Pass through timestamp of when the location was last retrieved successfully


https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-9286 / https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BPA-6115

name: Accessibility - Onboarding, Ticket Access, More Menu
description:
Critical Ballpark App flows and relevant test cases for ADA audit.

Initial flows:
*onboarding
*logging in
*forget password
*ticket access
*ticket forward (via email, suggested recipients, contacts, share link)
*ticket recall
*More / About BP (to assist with support)


The test cases are written with End to End customer flows in mind. 
Below are a list of particular pages in the flows, for each platform. 
The pages are included within each test case as the transitions occur. 
Included intentionally to be part of the audit, Error handling steps and validation on the pages within the onboarding/login flows.


|||:ANDROID|:iOS|:PageName
|| ANDROID PAGE 1 | IOS PAGE 1 | Welcome to Ballpark - Get Started 
|| ANDROID PAGE 2 |  | Sign UP
|| | IOS PAGE 2 | Create Account Modal
|| ANDROID PAGE 3 |  | Log In
|| | IOS PAGE 3 | Welcome to Ballpark - Continue with MLB
|| | IOS PAGE 4 | Log In Modal
|| ANDROID PAGE 4 | IOS PAGE 5 | Reset Password (Modal for iOS)
|| ANDROID PAGE 5 | IOS PAGE 6 | Home Page (NTE CARD/FORWARD CONTEXT CARD)
|| ANDROID PAGE 6 | IOS PAGE 7 | ScanView
|| ANDROID PAGE 7 | IOS PAGE 8 | ListView
|| ANDROID PAGE 8 | IOS PAGE 9 | TicketsTab > Wallet Page
|| ANDROID PAGE 9 | IOS PAGE 10 | TicketsTab > Wallet Page > View All
|| ANDROID PAGE 10 | IOS PAGE 11 | ListView > ForwardTickets
|| ANDROID PAGE 11 | IOS PAGE 12 | ListView > ForwardTickets > Delivery Method prompt
|| ANDROID PAGE 12 | IOS PAGE 13 | Forward Via Email 
|| ANDROID PAGE 13 | IOS PAGE 14 | ListView > Cancel/Recall prompt
|| ANDROID PAGE 14 | IOS PAGE 15 | ListView > ForwardTickets > Are you Sure prompt
|| ANDROID PAGE 15 | IOS PAGE 16 | ScanView > Cancel/Recall prompt
|| ANDROID PAGE 16 | IOS PAGE 17 | MoreTab
|| ANDROID PAGE 17 | IOS PAGE 18 | MoreTab > About
|| ANDROID PAGE 18 | IOS PAGE 19 | MoreTab > About > About Ballpark
|| ANDROID PAGE 19 | IOS PAGE 20 | MoreTab > FAQ webview

name: TM SDK
description: Epic: [BP-9842](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-9842)

name: Prompt Camera Access
description:
Vendors integrating with Ballpark want to be able to create concepts that depend on access to a device camera. Due to the vendor program limiting these concepts to webviews only, they require access to the camera while inside the app (instead of using native camera outside of the app for deeplinking purposes)

As a fan attending a ballpark, I want to be able to scan codes around the park within the Ballpark app to engage with AR features and access custom payment methods

name: Qualtrics SDK
description:
Epic [BP-10290](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-10290 )
Implementation of Qualtrics SDK [BP-10371](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-10371 )

*ANDROID ONLY 

Prerequisite - Remote Config Setup: enable_qualtrics
1. Go to Firebase -> Remote Config (links below)
2. Edit "enable_qualtrics" as needed to enable survey.  (eligibility for specific survey still needed to trigger)
3. Save changes.
4. Publish changes.

BE CAUTIOUS WHEN UPDATING PROD CONFIGURATION AS CHANGES WOULD BE WITNESSED TO LIVE USER

Remote Configs 
[Ballpark QA App](https://console.firebase.google.com/u/0/project/mlb-mobile-npd/config)
[Ballpark](https://console.firebase.google.com/u/0/project/mlb-ballpark-app-831/config)
(can have condition set up to differentiate desired behavior for different envs/platform)

name: Accessibility - GoAhead Entry Onboarding
description:
Ballpark App's GoAhead Entry allows for customers to onboard w/ a facial scan prior to game. On the day/night of the game, the customer can enter specific gates without having to scan their ticket. Here are the flows and relevant test cases for ADA audit.

Flows:
*GAE onboarding for customer w/ DOB over 18  [Acct to use: ballpark.applause@gmail.com / PW: BPapp123]
*GAE onboarding for customer w/ DOB under 18 [Acct to use: ballpark.applause+under@gmail.com / PW: BPapp123]

To enter into the specific GAE pages desired for ADA audit. Use provided (debug) builds that have been configured w/ the entry point (Go-Ahead Entry) within More menu(after login).


The test cases are written with End to End customer flows in mind. 
Below are a list of particular pages in the flows, for each platform. 
The pages are included within each test case as the transitions occur. 
Included intentionally to be part of the audit, Error handling steps and validation on the pages within the onboarding GAE flows.


|||:PageNum|:PageName
|| ANDROID/IOS PAGE 1 | GAE - SignUp page, Carousel 1 
|| ANDROID/IOS PAGE 2 | GAE - SignUp page, Carousel 2
|| ANDROID/IOS PAGE 3 | GAE - SignUp page, Carousel 3
|| ANDROID/IOS PAGE 4 | GAE - Learn More link (mlb.com page)
|| ANDROID/IOS PAGE 5 | Device Prompt - Camera access (when DOB over 18)
|| ANDROID/IOS PAGE 6 | GAE - Capture to generate MLB GAE ID (when DOB over 18)
|| ANDROID/IOS PAGE 7 | GAE - Image capturing w/ recommendations below (when DOB over 18)
|| ANDROID/IOS PAGE 8 | GAE - Generating GAE ID (when DOB over 18)
|| ANDROID/IOS PAGE 9 | GAE - Success - All Set (when DOB over 18)
|| ANDROID/IOS PAGE 10 | Device Prompt - DOB required (when DOB under 18)
|| ANDROID/IOS PAGE 11 | Device Prompt - Calendar picker (when DOB under 18)
|| ANDROID/IOS PAGE 12 | Device Prompt - Sorry, ineligible (when user enters DOB under 18)
|| ANDROID/IOS PAGE 13 | My Profile - GAE ID [AUDIT NOT NEEDED FOR THIS CASE]

name: CUE Light Show
description:
JIRAS:
* Vendor [VENEX-312](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/VENEX-312 )
* iOS [BP-10912](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-10912 )
* Android [BPA-7601](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BPA-7601 )

To Test:
* BP-App: In Staging only navigate to Miami Marlins → Staging Only → Cue Audio Testing and open up the Webview. The screen will remain blank until the light show is started.
* on Computer: 
Start an example own light show by navigating to the Cue Audio panel [https://mlb-test.cuelive.com/admin/#/home/light-show](https://mlb-test.cuelive.com/admin/#/home/light-show )
**username: mlb-test
**password: 25sloPsxyt
[CUE Audio - Light Show > ADMIN LOGINS:](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1U9577S8nsURGkOzmkxwf0bnGp8Rs7gKZO04TxkOfIsE/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.453a9v8r2rpj )

Click on Timeline and look for a play button to start the light show. (Make sure it was started from the beginning)

Notice that your camera light on your device(BPapp) syncs up with the show.
-------------------

Currently there is a remote config parameter [cue_audio_urls](https://console.firebase.google.com/u/0/project/mlb-ballpark-app-831/config/env/firebase?query=cue_audio_urls ) that contains a list of URLs that will open up the custom Cue Audio web view.
